善.definition: good (virtuous); benevolent; well-disposed; good at sth; to improve or perfect

善始善終.definition: where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth; to carry things through; I started, so I'll finish.

善後.definition: to deal with the aftermath (arising from an accident); funeral arrangements; reparations

善後借款.definition: reconstruction loan provided by Great Powers to Yuan Shikai in 1913

善忘.definition: to be forgetful; to have a short memory

善惡.definition: good and evil; good versus evil

善於.definition: to be good at; to be adept at

善有善報.definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another

善有善報，惡有惡報.pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4
善有善報，惡有惡報.definition: virtue has its reward, evil its retribution

善本.definition: old book; good book; reliable book; rare book

善用.definition: to be good at using (sth); to put (sth) to good use

善罷干休.definition: variant of 善罷甘休|善罢甘休[shan4ba4-gan1xiu1]

善罷甘休.definition: (idiom) to let the matter rest; to just let it go; to take it lying down (usu. used in the negative)

善自為謀.definition: to be good at working for one's own profit (idiom)

善解人意.definition: to be good at understanding others (idiom)

善變.definition: fickle; mercurial; changeable; capricious; to be apt to change

善財難捨.definition: to cherish wealth and find it hard to give up (idiom); refusing to contribute to charity; skinflint; miserly
